meanings.definition: Give someone a freehold estate in property.
meanings.sent1: The king enfeoffed his loyal knight with a piece of land.
meanings.sent2: The generous landlord enfeoffed the farmer with a plot of land to cultivate.
meanings.sent3: The magician enfeoffed the rabbit with a tiny crown, making it the ruler of the garden.
meanings.sent4: The teacher enfeoffed the student with the responsibility of leading the class discussion.
meanings.sent5: The fairy godmother enfeoffed Cinderella with a beautiful gown for the royal ball.

meanings.definition: Invest someone with a freehold estate in property.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy merchant enfeoffed his son with a grand estate to manage.
meanings.sent2: The nobleman enfeoffed his daughter with a vast estate as her inheritance.
meanings.sent3: The chef enfeoffed the soup with a sprinkle of magical seasoning, making it irresistible.
meanings.sent4: The artist enfeoffed the canvas with vibrant colors, bringing the painting to life.
meanings.sent5: The coach enfeoffed the team captain with the authority to make strategic decisions during the game.
